What you need to know to travel nearby cities:

Trains run on Moscow time! So plan to leave and arrive at Moscow time, not local times.

You can buy tickets online, or at the train station, but itâ€™s easier online if you cannot speak Russian well.

Tomsk

Distance: Only 5 hours from Novosibirsk by train or 3 by car. The train is slow but the scenery is worth it.

Price: The train will cost about $7-10 each way.

What to see Tomsk is one of the oldest cities in Siberia, known for it's old wooden architecture, universities, and diversity. Tomsk is also home to many parks, theaters, a planetarium, beautifully colored houses and churches, and is a great city to walk around.

learn more...

Omsk

Distance: 7-9 hours from Novosibirsk by train.

Price: 1200-6000 rubles depending on ticket class.

What to see Omsk is a major historical and cultural center of Siberia. There are world-renowned monuments like the Assumption Cathedral and Omsk fortress, and many other cultural locations including a number of churches, historic sites, and various monuments. Omsk stands out, among other Russian cities, for its diverse architecture. The historic center of Omsk has a lot of faces and different architectural ensembles including 130 monuments of architecture.

learn more...

Irkutsk

Distance:30 hours from Novosibirsk by train. One hour and a half by plane.

Price: The train will cost about $45 and a flight may cost about $150, this depends on season.

What to seeIrkutsk is the city to go to in order to visit the famous Lake Baikal. You can fly for pretty cheap, or take a 20 hour train ride if you want to go super-low-budget. Remember to book hostels and hotels in advance, because they fill up quickly. There are many tours and busses you can take to the actual lake which take about 6 hours from Irkutsk.

learn more...

Krasnoyarsk

Distance: 12 hours by train. 1.5 hours by train.

Price: The train will cost about 2000-7000 each way. Starting at 10,000 rub by plane.

What to see Krasnoyarsk is known for its nature and has been referred to as the most beautiful city in Siberia. 'Krasy' meaning beautiful. Forested mountains and cliffs are prevalent south of the city. There are many hiking opportunities in the nearby forests, many of which offer nice viewpoints. In addition, there are many museums, monuments, festivals, and events. The Yenisey River flows through the city. The Krasnoyarsk hydroelectric dam, 20km upstream, prevents the river from freezing.

learn more...
